Replies.Reply: ...in places the track is still dangerously wet, but following a drivers meeting the decision has been taken. The race is going ahead...
This is bullshit. We have no control over our legacy. We cannot choose what we are remembered for...
Otherwise I wouldn't be remembered for my rivalry with this asshole. And the 1976 season.
What about Hunt? Has he changed?
I don't know why it became such a big thing. We were just drivers. Busting each other's balls. To me this is perfectly normal. But other people saw it differently.
Be, allora usiamo anche noi quells da bagnato.
The ten-second board is held up.
Maybe that explains the state of mind I was in. And why it happened. The other thing I'm remembered for.

Bullshit. Where's Hunt?
C'mon...!!
What's GOING ON???
Umgotteswillen...
Hey...asshole! That was my line! I had that corner...

Fuck you! What's your name?
Fine. Keep your money. Don't invest in me. But when I'm World Champion, and I have the trophy, and my name is not just on the back pages, but on the front too, you will regret it.
I know. There is no room for failure.
Who's the number one driver?
Why would I defer to him if I am paying his wages?
OK. There is one clause missing.
And I made it perfectly clear that my mechanics work for me. No one else.
While you're at it you can tell them to amend the clause for podium finishes. Podium is first THREE places, not just wins.
You'll get the money on signature, as agreed. See you at winter testing.
Niki Lauda. Here for pre-season testing. BRM?
Lauda.
Thank you.
Worked here long?

Same as Regazzoni's?
She looks heavy. How much does she weigh?

Any solid plate, strip it out...

OK. Thank you. Good night..
What was his time?
OK. Now put him in my car, and he'll go round under two minutes.
That's information I will share with you under certain conditions only.
A guaranteed place in the team, and a paid contract on equal terms with Regazzoni for two years.
Well, as of now, if you want me to stay, we rip up the contract. I don't pay you a cent.

So have a think, work out your priorities, and get back to me.

Fine. How's it at the back?
Good. Look forward to you showing me the way today.
Yeah right.
Asshole.

I've driven better milk floats. It understeers like crazy and the weight distribution is a disaster...
I understand. It's business. I would be the same.
Not me. If I thought I had more talent and could earn better money doing something else, I would.
Not yet. But I will.
If you can, I can.
Why am I an asshole? You know by now I'm both quicker than you and better at setting up the car. You can't deal with that, then you're the asshole.
I'm sorry. C'mon, Clay...
Are you leaving?
Can you give me a lift to the nearest town? Anywhere with a train station.
You hear that noise when you accelerate?
Your drive belt is loose.
Alternator. And when you brake, your foot goes all the way down. Means there's air in the system.
No. Apart from the rear brakes are imbalanced. The front right wheel is flat, and it feels like a crack in the engine block...which explains why you're drifting so much.
My ass.
God gave me an OK mind, but a really good ass, which can feel everything in a car.
Not a good one.
Nothing I can do here. The car needs a garage.
No. As long as I'm back in Maranello by Monday morning.
Who's Curd?
Yes.
Yes, we do...
No need to drive fast. It only increases the percentage of risk.
And do you always get what you want?
Thank you.
Maybe the fact the car is so good might have something to do with me.
Never. You might get lucky and win one race. Maybe two. Because you're aggressive. But in the long run, over the course of a season, no chance.
Because you're not serious. You're just a party guy. Which is why everyone likes you.
But all that affection, all those smiles is also a sign of their disrespect! They don't fear you.
Right..

Right! Because I'm relentless. I don't screw up. I go to bed early. I look after myself, look after my car. And then, soon as the race is finished, I go home. You should go home more often, too. I heard you got married.
So where is she?
You know I've never seen you with her, once...
I noticed.
I noticed that, too.
Let's see where we are at the end of lap one.
Let's see where we are in six races time!!
Yeah, yeah...
So...six races in. How's it going so far?
What are you talking about?
In an illegal car.
At least it's a LEGAL monster.

He drives in an illegal car and he calls ME the cheat? Let me tell you: two weeks before that race in Spain, we put 20-inch rims on the rear wheels. We get an extra half second speed on each lap!! But the Old Man tells me we can't use those rims, they make the car too wide. Against the rules. So we go back to 19-inch rims making the car slower again. Rules are rules. For all of us. You're just a bad loser who can't accept that.
Komm, he's crazy. Sick in the head.
Den Trottel lassen wir alleine..
No wonder she left him...
Not at all. For him to catch me, he'd have to win all the remaining races, and I'd have to lose them. And pigs would have to fly.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have a private family matter to attend to.
It's the enemy, you know. Happiness.
It weakens you. Puts doubt in your mind. Because all of a sudden you have something to lose..

Thank you. I called this meeting because as all drivers know the Nurburgring is a race track from the Stone Ages. The most stupid, barbaric, outdated, dangerous, track in the world. Why? There would be no points for me either...

AAAAARRRRGHGHGGHGH!!!!
Aaarrrggghhhh...
Again!!
Aaaaarrrrggghghhhhhh!!
I know what you're all thinking...

Yes. You did.
No.
Trust me, watching you win those points and all those races while I was in hospital fighting for my life...you were equally responsible for getting me better.
Fine.

, to listen.

New car.

means rebuilding the car. Who lodged the complaint? It was Ferrari, wasn't it?
